title: i stranded aa said cant
story: I was stranded but AA said they cant prioritise lone women as "thats equality"Dr Helen Motts experience sparked backlash on twitter after she postied about her exchange with the AA, who twice told her they offer no priority to lone women who feel they are vulnerableDr Helen Mott was appalled by what she was told by the AA on Wednesday Image: Barbara Evripidou Bristol PostBySam Elliott-Gibbs:,  Jan | comments A worried woman says the AA are putting lives at risk after being told they refuse to prioritise lone females on the roadside at night because aposthataposs equalityapos. Dr Helen Mott slammed the breakdown rescue service after she was advised they do not base call outs solely on someoneaposs sex or gender.The -year-old was stranded on Wednesday and says she feared for her safety. With the evening fast approaching, the anxious mum told the operator she felt she was in a vulnerable position. She was stunned when they told her that she had to wait her turn - as they donapost give any kind of priority to those who consider themselves at risk.Do you agree  Have your say in the comment section  The British motoring association has drawn heavy criticism on social media for its stance. After tweeting about the exchange it provoking anger from other female motorists as the AA were forced into an apology.Dr Mott told The Sun : “The operator gave me an estimated time which was knocking on for a couple of hours.“I asked the call handler why they treated men and women the same and didn’t prioritise lone women. They said there’s no dference and they just said that’s equality. They’ve been trained to say it.”  After being picked up an AA truck less than an hour later, she tweeted the AA to confirm what she was told over the phone was the companyaposs official policy. They said: Hi Helen, youaposve been advised correctly. We donapost prioritise based on gender, we do consider the location so as an example we would prioritise someone on a motorway over someone in a supermarket carpark. Other twitter users expressed their outrage and women’s safety campaigners criticised the AAaposs stance. Sophie Francis-Cansfield, of Women’s Aid, was quoted as saying she believed womenaposs safety should be prioritised, as one is murdered by a man every three days in the UK.The AA later doubled down, and its president Edmund King intervened on Twitter and said the group does prioritise vulnerable customers after all.When askedthe motoring association makes no dference between a aposstranded female driver and a stranded maleapos, King said: Of course we do, and we use common sense and prioritise women but by the letter of the law we canapost say that. He later claried: It hasnapost changed. The wording of our initial response not great and we apologised. We prioritise anyone at risk but more often than not it will be lone women. In breakdowns involving lone women where there is any concern raised they receive the highest level of care and priority. Another AA spokesperson told the Mirror: We accept that the wording of our initial response wasn’t great and have apologised. In fact, we prioritise anyone at risk but more often than not it will be lone women. In breakdowns involving lone women where there is any concern raised by the customer, they receive the highest level of care and priority. Research from the Femicide Census calculated that across the UK, , women were killed by men in the  years to . This is around one killing every three days.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON The AAWomenPeople" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: mum 27 told not see
story: Mum, , told she may not live to babys birthday after tired, bloated feelingEstelle Wignall has defiantly insisted she is up for the fight and has launched a fundraising campaign to seek treatment for her oian cancer and terminal illness overseasYoung mum Estelle Wignall with husband Mike Image: Focus FeaturesByAnn CusackGraeme Murray:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A young mum fighting cancer has been warned she will not see her daughter’s next birthday. Estelle Wignall has stage four oian cancer which recently spread to her bowel and doctors have told her she is terminally ill.A mum to baby daughter, Brooke,  months, she has been offered palliative care.But Estelle insists she is up for the fight, and has launched a fundraising campaign through GoFundMe to seek treatment overseas.She says: “I feel as though I have been written off, but I am not ready to throw in the towel yet. I’ve bounced back before, and I am determined to do it again. To help Estelle raise money for treatment overseas, you can donate here. I want to celebrate my little girl’s second birthday, I want to see her start school, I want to mark as many milestones as I can.” Estelle, , from Wigan, Greater Manchester, was diagnosed with oian cancer five years ago after becoming tired and bloated. Doctors at first insisted she had IBS but her symptoms became so bad that she was rushed to hospital and then sent home again with medication. She said: “I picked up a leaflet in hospital about oian cancer and I immediately diagnosed myself. But everyone told me not to be so stupid because I was only  years old. “People said I was being a hypochondriac. Nobody took me seriously – but I just knew. It was an instinct.” Estelle pushed for tests and in February , she was finally diagnosed with grade one oian cancer. She had a tumour removed, along with her right oy and Fallopian tube. After making a full recovery, she put the cancer behind her, working as a receptionist and marrying soulmate Mike, , in June  in Texas. The couple had their first child, Brooke, in May . Estelle said: “I had only one oy and so to conceive so quickly felt like a miracle. I didn’t have my regular checks because I was pregnant, and during the birth the midwe actually noticed nodules on my cervix and I was referred for more tests, which came back clear. “We adored Brooke and the future looked fantastic.  “I was actually planning a hysterectomy so that there was no chance the cancer could .” But before her op, Estelle started to feel unwell, suffering from exhaustion and a lack of appetite. She said: “I had started the  week diet challenge, to get rid of my baby weight. I just needed to lose a stone, that was all. “But I started to feel very tired and I had no appetite. I thought it was all due to the diet – but it got worse and I began to think the cancer might be back.” In November , she was sent for urgent scans and was diagnosed with stage four cancer, which had spread to her liver and lungs.  She said: “I was devastated. The first time I had cancer, I coped well. But this time, because of Brooke, I was heartbroken. She was just six months old and it felt so cruel. I had only just started being a mum, and I didn’t want it to be taken away. She was initially told her le expectancy was only two or three years but her outlook improved after treatment and a raft of alternative therapies. “There have been points when I felt I could not go on. I considered euthanasia. But I kept going, and I got my spirits up again, she said. A recent scan showed the cancer has spread once again to the bowel and Estelle is now being warned that her time is fast running out. She says: “I’ve been on the brink before and I have bounced back and I am determined to do it again. I can’t give up, I have too much to live for, and I am determined to look for treatment abroad. “I hope also that my story can help other women, it is so important, no matter how young you are, to follow your instincts and to insist on answers. Don’t be fobbed off – it could cost you your le.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Oian cancerCancerHospitals" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: mum 33 tragically took life
story: Mum, , tragically took her own le after battling delayed postnatal depressionLisa Cook, , gave birth to her daughter in  but started to exhibit mental health issues after splitting with the childs father six years later, an inquest heardLisa Cook took her own le after battling delayed postnatal depression Image: Lisa Cook  Cavendish PressLtdByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan  A mum-of-one took her own le after battling a delayed post-natal depression years after she gave birth, an inquest heard.Lisa Cook, , gave birth to her daughter in  but only exhibited mental health issues six years later after splitting with the childaposs father. The HMRC client advisor received treatment but repeatedly made attempts on her le. Lisa also drank up to six bottles of wine a day, had a four-week stint in a rehabilitation clinic and was assessed by healthcare professionals. She vowed she had beat her illness. On July , Lisaaposs boyfriend found her hanged at the home near Oldham, Greater Manchester following concerns for her welfare. Tests revealed she had so much alcohol in her bloodstream that she would have been almost three times the drink driving limit. Lisa had no health problems earlier in le.  She studied Leisure and Tourism at college worked and for a telecoms company before getting a job with HMRC. Linda Rees, her mum, said in a statement: She had a child with her partner but they split in  and it was a dficult time for Lisa. Lisa and her daughter moved in with me and I believed she suffered from delayed post-natal depression. Eventually Lisa moved out and her daughter moved in with her father although everyone was on good terms. During the time Lisa was living with me, I noticed she was drinking a lot more alcohol - up to six bottles of wine per day. Sadly it was to mask her depression. In  she went into rehab for four weeks but I donapost think it worked because she continued to drink. Linda continued: She was sectioned for one week and diagnosed with bipolar, anxiety and depression.  The heartbroken mum said: When she was not drinking, she seemed fine and happy. She talked about feeling suicidal in the  months prior to her death. She would say the only thing stopping her from taking her le was me and her daughter. On July , I rang Lisa and woke her up. Later, she texted and she made some comment askingmy sandwich was more important than her and I told her to grow up. The next morning you sent her a text message but got no response. Later I received a call about the sad news that Lisa had passed away. Danny Howarth, who had been dating Lisa since November , said: She worked from home and was at high risk due to her medical condition. She would have very good and bad days when she would feel trapped. She had had demons from past concerns with her mental health. She hated taking her medication and when she felt better, she would stop. Sometimes she was her own worst enemy. I kept a diary of how she was and she was a binge drinker and could drink one or two bottles of wine or vodka a day.  At times, she would make threats to take her own le. I once rushed to her aid and found her with a kne. But on the weekend before she died, we talked about getting a house together and going on holiday. On the day before it happened, she told me she had a run-in with her mother. She was emotional and told her mother she was feeling suicidal and that her mother told her to grow up. The following day I sent a text message but I started to panic when she had not replied by .pm. I arrived at the house at .pm to see her slumped over in the corner of the lounge. When police arrived at the house, they found ious packs of antidepressants going back to  which had barely been taken,at all. Officers also found an empty bottle of pink gin and a half-full bottle of vodka. She had  milligrams of alcohol per  millilitres of blood in her system. The alcohol limit for driving in blood is mg. Recording a conclusion of suicide coroner Matthew Cox said: Lisa had tried to stop drinking and when that happened she was fine and happy but sadly the occasions where she tried to stop were not successful. Her mother talked about her being suicidal prior to her death. It is clear that Lisa was responsible for taking her own le. Delayed postpartum depression, also known as late-onset postpartum depression, can affect women up to  months after delivery, according to experts. It can even appear later than that in some women, depending on the hormonal changes that occur after having a baby.If youaposre struggling and need to talk, the Samaritans operate a free helpline open   on  . Alternatively, you can emailjo@samaritans.orgor visit their site to find your local branchRead MoreRead MoreFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON SuicideSamaritansMental healthAlcohol" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: mum 63 sheds 5st chucks
story: Mum, , sheds st and chucks old swimsuit away after family creates own fat loss dietEmma Scrivener, , from Swansea, Wales, and her family shed an impressive st in just months after inventing their own clean living dietEmma Scrivener, husband Tony, their daughter Katie Thomas and husband Shaun invented the diet Image: DA GroupByAndrea Blazquez:,  Jan | comments A family lost a combined  stone between them after coming up with their own diet.Emma Scrivener, , her husband Tony, their daughter mum-of-three Katie Thomas and husband Shaun created a plan that they say is easy to stick to. Emma, from Swansea, Wales, explained she was a size  when she decided to lose weight following a health scare.My blood pressure was extremely high and I had problems with my back and realised that something had to be done before I got progressively worse, she told the . Also we had been on a holiday and after seeing myself in a swimsuit realised I had piled on the weight.Have you been through a weight loss journey like Emma and her family  Let us know at webnews@mirror I had to make the decision that I would do nothing and regret it later or make the changes before it became too late. She went on to say she never expected to drop down to a size , but knewshe could get to a size  she would be very happy. What has become known as the DA diet consists of most foods, including treats like chocolate, crisps and cake.  But is about portion control. Emma said many people may be eating well but eating far too much. Her plan is well balanced with the correct amounts of protein, fats and carbohydrates.  It took her around  months to reach her target weight, losing five stone, as she was going through menopause. Shaun, on the other hand, lost five stone in five months, while Katie lost two stone in three months and Tony three and a half in five months. Emma said it should never be a race to lose weight and it is about each inidualaposs well-being. She admits her le has drastically changed after sticking it out, with no blood pressure issues or aches and pains. Emma was able to throw her old swimsuits away and now has no body confidence issues.The family started their weight loss journey in  and have since set up the DA Group which provides plans, as well as natural supplements, and includes Facebook groups and mentoring.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON DA GroupBlood pressureDietMenopauseSwimming costumesWeight loss success stories" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: pensioner 82 dementia left ae
story: Pensioner, , with dementia left in AE waiting room for  hours after collapsingWendy Parsons, , was pictured slumped in a chair in AE at Arrowe Park Hospital in Wirral, Merseyside, during her -hour wait for a bed after falling at homeWendy Parsons, , waited for  hours slumped in a chair in AE Image: Liverpool EchoByJonathan HumphriesRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Jan | comments An OAP was left slumped in a hospital waiting room chair for  hours after collapsing at home.Shocking photos show retired carer and mum-of-three Wendy Parsons at Arrowe Park Hospital in Wirral, Merseyside, waiting for a bed following the fall and bang to the head.The -year-old had been discharged from the hospital the previous afternoon, having been admitted with a suspected infection, reports the Liverpool Echo. Wendyaposs son Roger - who has been staying with his mum - found her lying on the floor at her home in Wallasey in the early hours of Wednesday. Daughter Colette Clarke has accused the hospital of giving the pensioner an unsafe discharge during her visit earlier in the week.Have you experienced a y waiting time in AE  Let us know at webnews@mirror  Wendy was admitted last Saturdayfeeling completely zonked out and appearing confused, her daughter said. With her infection markers having reduced, she was allowed to go home on Tuesday evening but was up all night. Collette said Roger found their mum on the floor around am the following day. The room looked like a tornado had been through it, I think she had thrown everything around in her confusion, she explained. Collette, who lives nearby, went on to say her mum is very blasé about her health despite suffering with arthritis, COPD and heart failure.But was nowhere near her baseline when staff allowed her to leave the hospital hours earlier. It became clear Wendy had suffered a bang to her head, which later developed into a large bruise. Colette drove her mum to AE later that morning as she seemed delirious.  Wendy was taken for CT scans and an X-ray but then was sent back to the waiting room until midnight before a bed became available, she said. Colette said it is a disgusting way to treat an elderly woman with multiple ailments. She praised those staff who saw her mum, calling them fantastic but said she has concerns about theof time she had to wait considering how frail she is. She questioned why the AE facilities went through a £m+ upgrade when they donapost have the staff to manage the space they have  In a recent inspection by healthcare watchdog the Care Quality Commission , concerns were raised about the way patients were dealt with in the hospitalaposs emergency department. The report noted there were not always enough staff to care for patients and not all those available had training in key skills required or could always identy and quickly act upon patients at risk of deterioration.A spokesperson for Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Trust said: We endeavour to ensure we provide patients with the best possible care in our hospitals and while we can’t discuss details of inidual patients, we can offer assurance that we have robust processes in place to ensure patients are discharged safely.Each patient is thoroughly assessed and provided with a care plan on discharge. Like other Trusts nationally we are experiencing an extremely busy period in our Emergency Department and we therefore prioritise those patients who are in the most urgent need of care which regretfully can mean a longer wait for some of our other patients. Our Senior Nursing Team will be in contact with the family to offer support, investigate their concerns and ensure that any lessons are learnt to improve patient experience. news uk-news prince-andrew-laughed-dog-bit-"Prince Andrew made profound error meeting Epstein says RellieBySam Elliott-Gibbs:,  Jan  A royal maid claims Prince Andrew simply laughed when he was informed his beloved dog had attacked her as she cleaned.Charlotte Briggs says the Duke of York shrugged off Norfolk terrier Bendicksapos vicious bite and didnapost offer an apology.The nine-year-old animal - named after Sarah Ferguson aposs favourite chocolates - reportedly went for the worker in . The dog was banned from Buckingham Palace because of the incident, but the Prince seemed to only see the funny side.Mrs Briggs has recalled what happened after she says Bendicks reacted badly when she started using the vacuum cleaner. She told The Sun her leg was left bleeding and her tights were ripped.The maid, then , was sent to the Duke’s personal physician for a tetanus jab, but when she quizzed a butler she was stunned by what she says was Andrewaposs reaction to the attack. She says “they just laughed - and nobody said sorry. “He wasn’t bothered, she said. Even when I was limping and my leg was purple he never apologised. It’s those little things that tell a lot about people and their character.” Bendicks also attacked a carpet fitter and the Duke’s equerry before his death in  aged , it was reported. It is the latest embarrassing anecdote to humiliate the Prince.It comes after reports the embattled Duke of York would allegedly scream and shoutBuckingham Palace servants failed to follow his exact plan for the arrangement of his teddy bears.He was also claimed he demanded his water be strictly served at room temperature and that his valet haul around a six-foot ironing board on foreign trips. Sources say the Duke was known for being rude and having childish obsessions - as he was ridiculed while on the road fulfilling royal duties, reports claim. The former deputy head of mission in Bahrain, Simon Wilson, says the royalaposs travelling entourage left people speechless. The diplomat, who had previously hosted the Duke, says the Prince became known as HBH - His Buffoon Highness.  He added that Andrew was rude and boorish and wasnapost well-liked. Andrew is awaiting a civil sex case in the US, with the trial scheduled to take place between September and December. Virginia Giuffre is suing the duke for allegedly sexually assaulting her when she was a teenager and claims she was trafficked by Andrew’s friend, the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, to have sex with the duke when she was  and a minor under US law. The Duke has always vehemently denied the allegations. title: prince andrews ex maid says
story: Prince Andrews ex-maid has no regrets about condemnation of horrible, nasty DukeEx-Buckingham Palace maid Charlotte Briggs, , said she has no regrets about speaking out against Prince Andrew, who she claimed often acted like a "spoiled brat"Prince Andrews former maid said she has no regrets in speaking out against him Image: Getty ImagesByRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan  A former Buckingham Palace maid says she has no regrets about speaking out against Prince Andrew and described him as a horrible man.Charlotte Briggs claimed the Duke of York often erupted into demanding and entitled foul-mouthed rants which left her in tears.The -year-old, who lives in Halax, West Yorkshire, made front-page news this week when she revealed her experiences doing the job nobody wanted six months after starting work for the royals in January .She described the Queenaposs second son as a spoiled brat who once allegedly - after noticing sheaposd left a gap in the curtains - fumed: Can’t you f***ing do anything right  Charlotte says since then she has been ridiculed in her hometown and accused of selling out.Do you enjoy reading about the royal family for all the best royal news from the Mirror here  But believes she is entitled to speak about what happened to me even though it was years ago. Charlotte has also been keen to point out while she considered Prince Andrewaposs attitude poor, she never witnessed any inappropriate behaviour. The Duke is facing a civil trial after being accused of sexual abuse by a trafficking victim of his late paedophile pal billionaire financier Jeffrey Epstein. Virginia Giuffre is suing Andrew for allegedly having sex with her in the US when she was .  He vehemently denies her allegations and has not been charged with any criminal offence.Speaking to the Daily Mail outside her home on Friday, Charlotte said: I donapost give a toss what Prince Andrew feels…he is a horrible, nasty man.She explained she had signed a privacy agreement under the Official Secrets Act not to ulge any accounts of her time at the Palace. But on seeing ITVaposs documentary this week - which included claims by another ex-staff member that Andrew had a map for exactly where his cuddly toys needed to be on the bed - she decided to breach it.The mum-of-two said: I am not sorry at all. But I have been hurt by some of the remarks against me. In her original interview, she said Andrewaposs brothers Prince Charles and Prince Edward, as well as all other royals she encountered, were wonderful. She was just  when she started work at the Palace and started working for Andrew when he was  - at a time when he had recently orced from Sarah Ferguson. Charlotte was paid £ a month and was pictured on the royal balcony ahead of the Trooping the Colour ceremony the same year. It comes as the Queen stripped the Duke of his royal titles and patronages ahead of his trial in New York and he is facing eviction from the Royal Lodge in Windsor. Buckingham Palace declined to comment on Charlotte Briggsapos accusations when approached by the Mirror. news uk-news prince-charles-hopping-mad-andrew-"Prince Charles ignores question about Prince AndrewByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Jan Prince Charles was hopping mad after claims Prince Andrew had family support toto public le, a royal expert has said.Andrew stepped down from public le in  after his car crash interview on BBC Newsnight where spoke he about his association with the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. But in late , it was reported that Andrew wanted toto public le with claims that he had his family backing to do so. However, speaking on True Royalty TVaposs The Royal Beat, Sunday Times royal editor Roya Nikkhah said when this story emerged, Charles was not happy. She explained: Everyone in the Royal Family has been of the view he couldn’t come back, except Prince Andrew, who did a litmus test with us last year when a source close to him said ‘he thinks he has a future role’. I went to the Prince of Wales with that and suffice to say the Prince of Wales was hopping mad because Andrew said he had family support to come back, and he did not have family support to come back to public le.” Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up.Last week, it was announced that the Queen had taken back the military affiliations and royal patronages sheaposd previously given to her second oldest son signalling there was no way back for him.The Duke of York is mired in sex abuse claims and now facing a civil trial. Andrew vehemently denies all allegations against him. The Mirror exclusively revealed Her Majesty ruthlessly made her mind up about the Duke of York after a summit with future king Prince William at her Windsor Castle home last week.A statement from Buckingham Palace last week read: With The Queen’s approval and agreement, The Duke of York’s military affiliations and Royal patronages have been ed to The Queen. The Duke of York will continue not to undertake any public duties and is defending this case as a private citizen. While a royal source added: All of The Duke’s roles have been handed back to The Queen with immediate effect for redistribution to other Members of the Royal Family. They will notto The Duke of York. title: queen ordered petulant andrew back
story: Queen ordered petulant Andrew to back down over royal loo dispute with CharlesFormer Buckingham Palace maid Janette McGowan said during Christmas  at Sandringham, Prince Andrew put his toiletries in the bathroom meant for Prince Charles and refused to move themPrince Andrew is said to have once refused to move his toiletries from a bathroom meant for brother Charles Image: Getty ImagesByRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Jan Prince Andrew once had to be ordered down by the Queen in a bizarre squabble with older brother Charles over a toilet, it has been claimed.The Duke of York, aged  at the time of the alleged incident, refused to remove his toiletries from a royal bathroom at Sandringham meant for the Prince of Wales and future king. He finally relented when his mum intervened, according to an ex-maid. Former Buckingham Palace staff member Janette McGowan - who had travelled with the Firm to the residence in Norfolk - revealed Andrewaposs childish tantrum, said to have happened over Christmas . She said astonished colleagues were alerted to the situation after the Duke put his things into the wrong bathroom and then refused to move them.Do you enjoy reading about the royal family for all the best royal news from the Mirror here  Charles would have been  at the time.Ms McGowan told The Sun : We were told not to move anything and not to touch anything in that bathroom because there was an aposongoing situationapos.She explained that when members of the family travel to Sandringham - where the monarch usually hosts her annual festive lunches - they are each allocated rooms and bathrooms. But on this occasion Andrew took the wrong one and wouldnapost budge, the former maid continued, adding: It turned into a bizarre stand-off.  In the end, the Queen herself had to intervene to defuse the situation. She actually had to have words with Andrew and say to him that he had to use the other bathroom and that was when he finally backed down. He was almost  at the time. It was very odd behaviour for someone of that age. She added, in contrast, Prince Charles was very grown-up about it and simply waited for the Queen to step in. Ms McGowan, , worked at the Palace from  to , and said the strangest thing was there was nothing special about the bathroom, but rather Andrew seemed to resent Charles being regarded as superior.  He arrived first and put his toiletries in a bathroom that wasnapost opposite his bedroom, she said.It comes after another former maid said she had no regrets in speaking out against Andrew who she described as a horrible man.Charlotte Briggs claimed the Duke of York often erupted into demanding and entitled foul-mouthed rants which left her in tears.The -year-old, who lives in Halax, West Yorkshire, made front-page news this week when she revealed her experiences doing the job nobody wanted six months after starting work for the royals in January . She described the Queenaposs second son as a spoiled brat who once allegedly - after noticing sheaposd left a gap in the curtains - fumed: Can’t you f***ing do anything right  Charlotte says since then she has been ridiculed in her hometown and accused of selling out.But believes she is entitled to speak about what happened to me even though it was years ago.Charlotte has also been keen to point out while she considered Prince Andrewaposs attitude poor, she never witnessed any inappropriate behaviour. The Duke is facing a civil trial after being accused of sexual abuse by a trafficking victim of his late paedophile pal billionaire financier Jeffrey Epstein. Virginia Giuffre is suing Andrew for allegedly having sex with her in the US when she was . He vehemently denies all allegations and has not been charged with any criminal offence. usual BA.  type Omicron Covid mutation has also been found in other European countries" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _PAY-Vaccinations-Kent.jpg" incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _PAY-Vaccinations-Kent.jpg" data-tracking"twitter|share|top" today said the sister iant of the usual BA.  type Omicron Covid mutation has also been found in other European countries" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _PAY-Vaccinations-Kent.jpg" data-tracking"whatsapp|share|top"| comments Scientists are investigating a new Omicron sub-strain that has been found in  people in the UK.The UK Health Security Agencytoday said the sister iant of the usual BA.  type Omicron has also been found in other European countries. A new sub-strain of the Omicron Covid iant is being investigated by scientists after it was discovered in the UK.At the present moment, there is no indication that sub-iant BA. is more severe than the original strain of Omicron. In Denmark, this strain consisted of about half of all Omicorn cases. Initial studies from the country are suggesting there is no increased risk of hospitalisation.  It is also thought that the current vaccines are effective against the BA. strain in fighting severe illness, according to Danish health officials. However, it is unclear whether the strain could be more transmissible as more data is needed to test that possibility. UKHSA are continuing to monitor data on the BA. sub-lineage closely. The strain BA. shares a number of similarities with BA., which is why they are both considered to be Omicron. However, it has dferent S-gene mutations compared to BA., which means when carrying out a PCR test BA. shows positive for the S-gene while BA. does not.Susan Hopkins, Chief Medical Advisor at UKHSA, said: “This latest set of analysis once again demonstrates that a booster dose of the vaccine provides you with signicant protection against hospitalisation from Omicron.Booster doses also increase the protection against symptomatic and asymptomatic infection which will reduce transmission in the population.While signs remain encouraging on Omicron’s severity compared with Delta, the high levels of community transmission continue and may cause pressures on health services. “We’ll be undertaking further analysis to investigate the small rise in the number of children admitted to hospital but currently Covid- poses a very low health risk to children and infants.Early data shows that young children who are hospitalised experience mild illness and are discharged after short stays in hospital.“Getting your booster jab remains the most effective way of protecting yourself and others from infection and severe disease. While prevalence remains high, make sure to wear your mask in indoor settings and take a lateral flow test before meeting others. If you develop any symptoms, isolate immediately and get a PCR test.”Health and Social Care Secretary Sajid Javid said: “This data is yet more evidence that vaccines remain our best line of defence against COVID-.“Booster jabs are protecting people against infection and severe disease – so I urge you to play your part in our national mission and get boosted now.”Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON HospitalsPublic servicesOmicron iantCoronavirus" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily coronavirus briefing with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: sunbed addict mum bravely shows
story: Sunbed addict mum bravely shows off bald patch after skin cancer left hole in her headWARNING - GRAPHIC IMAGES: Childminder Nickie Murtagh, , used sunbeds twice a week but after discovering a dry patch on her scalp she was diagnosed with basal cell carcinoma, a form of skin cancerNickie Murtagh decided to see her doctor after a dry patch on her scalp turned into a lump Image: Nickie Murtagh   CATERS NEWSByBeth KilgallonSam Elliott-Gibbs:,  Jan | comments A former sunbed addict has been left with a bald patch after skin cancer left a hole in her head. Nickie Murtagh, , a childminder from London, used the beds twice a week before discovering a dry patch on her scalp. It soon turned into a lump and she raced to the doctor before hearing the news she had basal cell carcinoma, a form of skin cancer. Since successfully having the lump removed and a skin graft from her thigh, mum-of-three Nickie has been left with a bald patch on her scalp which she says looked like she has been shot in the head. Nickie now wears SPF all year round and wants to raise awareness of the dangers that sunbeds and sun damage can cause to your skin.Were you aware of this  Join the discussion in the comment section  She said: When I was in my twenties I would use a lot of sunbeds. I went a couple of times a week and would go on for about eight to  minutes. I didnapost exceed the recommended, so I didnapost think too much of it. I would also avoid using sun cream, especially on my face, because I didnapost want to stop myself from catching a tan. I thought that sun cream would stop me tanning, which I know now isnapost the case. First of all, I noticed a dry patch on my scalp which eventually turned into a lump in my parting line. I went to the doctors to get it checked out but they told me it was fine and nothing to worry about. I then went on holiday to Tenere and it got much worse. I was also getting bad melasma on my face and my tan was very patchy. My skin just didnapost feel right at all. After ing from her holiday, Nickie went back to the doctors where she says she was told, once again, that everything was fine. But the lump on her head was making her self-conscious, so she decided to go back to the doctors because she wanted it removed whether it was cancer or not. Nickie said: The doctors told me it was a cosmetic procedure and I would have to pay for it. I got really upset and eventually, they sent a referral to the dermatologist. After an appointment with the dermatologist, they told me they thought it was cancer straight away and biopsied me there and then. While waiting for the results, my family stayed so positive and reassured me it was going to be fine and although the dermatologist thought it was cancer, I still wasnapost really expecting it. Seven weeks later I received the results and I was told it was skin cancer - basal cell carcinoma. When I heard the C word I instantly felt like my world was ending and I was going to die. I worried about my kids and my family. It was terrying. I was offered radiotherapy or surgery. I chose surgery because it was less invasive and avoids the side effects that come with radiotherapy. I just wanted it to be gone. So I had surgery to remove the cancer and a skin graft from my thigh which was successful and I was given the all-clear. Nickie says that the skin graft was the worst part of her experience as her thigh would not stop bleeding. After having the staples removed from the area that the lump was removed from, she says that it was so gruesome and shocking. Nickie added: It was awful. It looked like I had been shot in the head. And I was terried to wash my hair and make it worse. My hair hasnapost and wonapost grow back in that area because the skin is from my thigh. And I have also lost all feeling in it. I canapost see it very well because it is on the top of my head, but it makes me feel self-conscious when I catch people staring at it or sometimes kids point it out. I try to use it to teach them a lesson to wear hats and sun cream. I also donapost like to wear shorts because people can see the scar on my leg from the skin graft. I am so much more cautious in the sun now and I avoid sunbeds at all cost. I am much more educated about sun damage and sun protection. I always wear a hat and I have SPF on every single day of the year. The sun doesnapost have to be hot to cause damage. title: teen handed 15 year sentence
story: Teen handed -year sentence for stabbing of Reece Tansey, , in planned attackReece Tansey was stabbed in the early hours of May , , in Bolton before going on to desperately bang on the door of a nearby house to plead for helpPolice arrived at the scene minutes later and Reece was rushed to Salford Royal Hospital, where he was pronounced dead at .am Image: MEN MEDIAByAbigail OLearyNews Reporter:,  Jan A teenage attacker who was found guilty of murdering Bolton schoolboy Reece Tansey has been handed a -year sentence. Another boy, found guilty of manslaughter for his part in the brutal stabbing of -year-old Reece, was jailed for six years. A court heard that the attackers - named Boy A and Boy B for legal reasons - had agreed to meet up in the early hours of May  in Walker Avenue, Bolton, because of an escalating dispute between Boy B and a friend of the victim. But when Reece arrived he was stabbed six times by Boy A. He banged on the door of a nearby house desperately pleading for help before falling to the ground. And, having been discovered by two men, he used his final breath to tell them the names of his killers.  Police arrived at the scene minutes later and Reece was rushed to Salford Royal Hospital, where he was pronounced dead at .am. A pathologist concluded his death was caused by multiple stab wounds, which were likely to have been inflicted by a kne with a -cm blade. After fleeing the scene, Boy A sent a Snapchat video of himself carrying a kne covered in blood, accompanied by the word muppet. He later sent a message to Boy B, which read: I thought it only went through his coat so I kept doing it. Adding: Heaposs dead now. Boy B responded with a laughing emoji.  Both teenagers appeared at a sentencing hearing at Manchester Crown Court todaywhere judge Justice Farbey was told there was a long-standing hate between Boy B and Reece, and Boy A had been brought into the dispute as support. During a three-week trial, jurors heard that the two boys had goaded Reece and his friend into meeting them, but he was initially reluctant. The court heard he had sent a message to his friend, which read: Getting brought into your s* again. Ainapost in no f**** mood. All four boys eventually agreed to meet that night and Reece left home and headed to the rendezvous point near Great Lever Park. But as Reece was en route, his friend informed him that he had decided to stay in bed.  Before the trial Boy A admitted to killing Reece but denied murder. Boy B admitted he was there but denied killing Reece or knowing Boy A had a kne. Richard Wright QC, who represented Boy A in the trial, told the court how the dispute was part of a petty subculture brought on via social media. Mr Wright said: It is a fact that they were all young people and a fact that their culture, that all of them engaged in, driven by social media led to them meeting up. He added: It might be said that all were particularly vulnerable due to their age, from being drawn into this petty sub-culture of social media interactions and bravado. They were all vulnerable to that and unfortunately one of them lost their le.  In a victim statement read out in court, Reeceaposs mum Laura said: Reece was our -year-old son, he made us smile, he made us laugh, he made us tear our hair out at times, a typical teenage lad, but he was ours. Reece was fiercely protective of his mum and little brother and saw himself as the man of the house. His dad saw him as his best friend. Reece was simply our world, and his death has devastated us beyond belief. Boy A was handed a -year-old sentence while Boy B was jailed for six years.Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Court caseHospitalsCrown courtMurder trialCrimeTeenagersKne crime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news worried-voters-plan-keep-face-"Boris Johnson confirms Plan B Covid measures will end on January ByJeremy ArmstrongNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments Worried voters in Englandaposs Covid- aposhotspotsapos claim Boris Johnson is risking lives by reducing coronavirus restrictions - to save his own political skin. The North East of England has suffered some of the countryaposs highest Covid infection rates in . Experts say it is an Omicron hotspot after the outbreak moved north from London.The region was home to seven of the  local authorities with the highest infection rates this month. One in  peoplein the region tested positive in the week to January , the highest of any point in the pandemic.  The alarming rate of infection was highest in Middlesbrough with , cases per , people. Stockton came in third in England, Hartlepool fourth and Redcar fth in UK Health Security Agency research. Today education chiefs, politicians and ordinary voters united to condemn the Governmentaposs lting of compulsory mask wearing and working from home rules. Former steel worker Barry Heseltine, , of Redcar, North Yorkshire, said: He is lting the restrictions to save his own skin.  He is doing this to take away from the trouble he is in. But we will wear the masks for a while yet. His we Joyce, , added: I voted for him but he shot himself in the foot. He probably thinks it will blow over like everything . I thought he did well at first. Not now. Retired telephonist Patricia Blackett, , from Thornaby on Teesside, was wearing a mask and would continue to do so indoors at crowded venues like cinemas and theatres.  She added: I think the Prime Minister is trying to appease us and the people in the party. He is trying to take attention away from what he has done.Butyou have lost a loved one I donapost think that you will forget that and vote for him again. He has lost all credibility. I voted Tory but I am all for Keir Starmer now.He is a smart lawyer, a QC. I think that I will vote for him next time, the same goes for my daughter and son. Sixth formers Faith Lucas and Jessica Brown, both  and from Brotton, East Cleveland, are both planning to wear masks even after the Government lts the restriction.  Jessica, a psychology, business and law student, said: I think that I will keep on wearing one into the summer when it will become more dficult when it is hot. I think Boris is guilty of double standards with parties, he asked us to stick to the rules, but he did not do that himself. Faith added: You need to keep masks in enclosed spaces, especially on transport. I am not involved in politics just yet but obviously he should not have been having a party in lockdown. I know there is now a lot of pressure on him.Mum-of-two Pauline Collins, , of Middlesbrough, vowed to continue mask-wearing while shopping, on buses and on trains. I am not really sure about Boris Johnson, she said.I do think he should not be lting the restrictions completely. You should wear them on public transport and places like shopping centres. It is dferent for the young, they are not as worried about it as us oldies.  Singer John Rowland, , a dad-of-three who worked in Spain, Greece, Holland, Germany, Italy and Gibraltar before setting up as a busker in Middlesbrough town centre  years ago, said there is no saving Boris Johnson. Pardon the language, he has been a cluster****, he told the Mirror. It has gone too far for him now so it does not matter what he does. You look at other countries that have dealt with Covid so much better. I have friends in New Zealand, their leaders have handled it properly. He told how his we Hayley, , and children Grace, , Alex,, and eight-year-old Noah all went down with Covid before Christmas. He added: My we works in a school and got the Delta strain  months ago and she was really ill, and then we all got what was probably the Omicron iant. I was not at deathaposs door, it was like a bad flu virus. But I would not wish it on anybody, we have seen so many people lose loved ones.  Middlesbrough Labour MP Andy McDonald said his office was inundated with voters complaining about Boris Johnson. They are expressing their sheer anger at him. Welsh leader Mark Drayford summed it up, he said. He is being guided by the data and public health priorities, we are being driven by politics. I would be guided by the professionals who think we should maintain our guard for a little longer. On masks, people will make their own minds up and I support them fully on that. Almost  per cent of North East schools reported staff levels of below  per cent this week. At a quarter of them, it was less than  per cent. Only one in ten schools had student attendance levels of more than  per cent.  Chris Zarraga, director of campaign group Schools North East, said: Schools are still facing real challenges in getting staff cover, increasing staff workload and stress. There are serious concerns for schools, with local pictures often radically dferent from the national picture. The Government must support headteachers to put in place those measures necessary for their own school’s context. Andy Byers, headteacher at Framwellgate School, Durham, has asked students to keep wearing masks. More than  pupils and  members of his staff are isolating, with a small number quite poorly. In Stockton-on-Tees, pop up vaccination clinics are in place. Sarah Bowman-Abouna, their Director of Public Health, said: “We know uptake across Teesside is lower than other parts of the country. We are tackling this by making it as easy as possible for people to come to a walk-in centre. We want to discourage this myth that the Omicron iant is less serious than other iants. The truth is we can’t guarantee that infection will cause less serious illness so it’s vital we vaccinate as many people as possible.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Boris JohnsonJohn Grosvenor RowlandConservative PartyEducationSchoolsPublic transportShopping centresFluPoliticsChristmas partyCoronavirusDaily Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily coronavirus briefing with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: mum left two young kids
story: Mum left two young kids alone while she enjoyed party getaway weekend with boyfriendKerry Lyn Caviasca allegedly left her two children, both below the age of , home alone for two days in November - with messages reportedly showing them texting her asking what they should eat for dinnerCaviasca, a teacher from Connecticut, is accused of leaving the children to survive on sweets and Uber deliveries while she went on holiday to Florida Image: Watertown Police DepartmentByAbigail OLearyNews Reporter:,  Jan A mum left her two young kids alone to enjoy a party getaway weekend with her boyfriend. Kerry Lyn Caviasca allegedly left her children, both below the age of , home alone for two days in November.Caviasca, a teacher from Connecticut, is accused of leaving the children to survive on sweets and Uber deliveries while she went on holiday to Florida and partied with her boyfriend, according to court documents obtained by NBC Connecticut.Caviasca’s ex-husband reported her police in December. He claimed both children missed school on Monday, November , and he was unable to contact them over the weekend. Court documents claim he told police he sent his own father to the house to check on them, but he wasn’t able to reach the children. When the concerned father later asked the children whether they had been left home alone, they told him no, reports the New York Post. But after going through messages on a phone he had brought for one of the children, he reportedly saw a number of messages between Caviasca and the children over the course of the weekend in question. Some of the messages reportedly show the children asking their mother what they should eat for dinner, with her allegedly replying Just eat candy and What ever [sic] is downstairs. Police arrived at Caviasca’s home after initial reports, but she originally claimed her brother had been looking after the children - before eventually admitting they had been left alone. Caviasca was arrested on January  and charged with two counts of risk of injury to a minor and two counts of reckless endangerment in the second degree, according to NBC Connecticut. She is to appear in court on Jan. . Waterbury Public Schools district said Caviasca had been placed on leave while the district conducts its own investigation. title: laundry experts claim were definitely
story: Laundry experts claim were definitely not washing our bed sheets enoughHygiene experts have revealed that keeping your bed clean and washing your sheets more often can help thwart germs and allergens, and has even been found to help you sleep betterYou might not be washing your sheets enoughImage: Getty Images Image SourceBySusan KnoxShowbiz and Entertainment Reporter:,  Jan | commentsItaposs an easy task to forget at the best of times, but you should probably be changing your bed sheets more often than you already are.While thereaposs nothing better than hopping into a bed full of fresh sheets after sprucing up your bedroom, experts have claimed that the average person is not washing their bed linen enough. Although busy schedules can sometimes get in the way of giving your bed a refresh, experts at the Sleep Foundation have revealed that we should all be washing our bed sheets at least once a week - insisting that every couple of weeks doesnapost cut it.And in some cases, you should be washing your sheets even more than the recommended amount of once a week. Experts have suggested that someone who suffers from asthma or allergies should wash their sheets more frequently to improve overall wellbeing.  Andyouaposre someone who sleeps with a beloved dog or cat, then you should consider throwing your sheets in the washing up to twice a week to get rid of germs and bacteria that your furry friends may have carried from their outdoor adventures. If youaposre someone who likes to eat snacks when in bed, you should also be washing your sheets more than once a week. And people who go to bed without showering, or people who sleep naked, should also follow suit and stock up on some extra washing powder.  The biggest mistake many of us make is leaving our bedding on for more than a week, as they warn it leads to us apossleeping while surrounded by body oils, bacteria, dead skin cells, and dust mitesapos. Keeping your bed clean and hygienic can help thwart germs and allergens, and has even been found to help you sleep better. When it comes to your duvet, it doesnapost need washing as often as your sheets, but itaposs always good to give them a good clean every now and then - ideally every two months. Pillows should be washed at the same time, and the mattress itself should be given a clean down once a year. According to recent research, % of people are more excited to go to bed when their sheets are fresh and smell good. So, itaposs time to get washing.Do you have any cleaning tips of your own  Let us know in the comments.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON ViralCleaningSleep" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news mcdonalds-worker-explains-take-your-"McDonald’s worker reveals truth about drive-through ordersByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA McDonaldaposs worker has revealed the secret behind the smooth running of the restaurant, and itaposs blowing customersapos minds.Katie, who is known as @katieeclarkee on TikTok, explained that the fast-food restaurant has cameras installed around the drive-thru - and theyaposre not just for security purposes.In the clip, which has since been viewed . million times, Katie explained that the cameras snap a photo of you to help staff keep track of multiple orders with ease.During her sht, she showed viewers the drive-thru camera and demonstrated how it works. She says: Ever wondered how McDonaldaposs know whose car is whose  There is a camera and it takes a picture of you and your car, she said. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. The -year-old explained that the orders are handed to the correct customer thanks to a handy camera. After an order is placed, a camera takes a snap of the car, linking it to the order. So the worker just has to match the picture with the car in front of them. She later joked: So maybe don’t pick your nose when you order … because we see it and we judge you. Since being posted, the video has wowed McDonaldaposs fans. One said: Wow really  I had no idea there were cameras. Another said: Ayo thataposs some new new. We didnapost have that when I worked there last year. A third said: Wait yaposall see us  Fellow employees also revealed that they can hear everything that goes on inside the customersapos car from the moment it pulls up and activates the sensor, which then triggers their headset to turn on. Iaposm waiting for the day they realise we hear them the moment they pull up, to the moment they leave the speaker box, the worker said. But unfortunately for one member of staff, they admitted the McDonaldaposs he works at is not that advanced, and that we just have to figure it out. Did you know this  Let us know in the comments below. title: my mother law always snoops
story: My mother-in-law always snoops through my stuff so I played a prank on herA woman took to Reddit to ask users whether she was out of order for playing a prank on her mum-in-law after her fiance got mad at her - but users were on her side Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan | commentsA woman has asked whether she was in the wrong for playing a prank on her mum-in-law after she caught her snooping through her stuff. The woman explained that after being together for four years, her fiancé finally moved in with her. She bought her home seven years ago, so the majority of the furniture is hers, but theyaposre talking of aposmaking it a home for both of them.apos But sheaposs noticed when his mum comes over she snoops and goes through her stuff.Taking to Reddit, she said: One thing she snooped on was actually embarrassing. In my home office, I had a little aposaffirmationapos post-it note on my monitor saying aposI am smart, I am skilled, I am deserving of great thingsapos.It was a silly thing my therapist recommended to get me in a confident mindset before an interview. Anyway, she made a comment about my ego... So while wine drunk one night, she and her friend decided to write a few more aposaffirmationsapos to hide as a joke. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Some were: Medicine cabinet: My teeth will regrow! I am sharklike and powerful! Kitchen drawers: I know when to spoon, but I also know when to fork! I am sexy and self-assured! Work desk: I will not just f**k my way to the top of the company, I will f**k my way to the top of the world! Walk-in closet: I am beautul with clothes and without! Especially without! My boobs are legendary! The next time her mother-in-law came over, she saw a few and while she didnapost directly acknowledge them, she did start acting really strangely. I went to run some errands and when I was out, she confronted Al about the notes and was trying to tell him that I seemed unstable, egotistical, and moving in was a bad idea, she continued. She then showed him the notes and he didnapost really know what to make of it. He asked me and I said that they were just some silly private notes to boost my self-confidence and make myself laugh how had she gotten them  Had she been going through my things  He said she was just tidying, and saw them. And they were really weird. He askedI left them on purpose to annoy her, and I admitted that was kinda the joke, but I also have other weird or private s**t so what I said about her needing to stop snooping. He said I was making stuff hard for him, his mum was really protective and adjusting to him moving in with a girlfriend for the first time, and I was agitating her on purpose and making her think I wouldnapost be a good partner when he wanted her to have the opposite impression of me! She concluded her post by asking users whether she was out of order for playing the prank, and the majority of people were on her side as they slammed the mother-in-law for invading her privacy. While others criticised her fiance for not standing up for her. One person said: If you don’t set boundaries with your fiancé’s mother now, it’s going to be infinity times worse once you get married. Another wrote: It says a lot how he keeps defending her and chalks it up to be overprotectiveness. While I always hate to jump on the band wagon of aposomg this is immensely terrible you should break up over a moderate thingapos, I will say this is a red flag. A third commented: So you’ve been dating for four years. Are now engaged. And his mum is still uncertainyou’re right for each other  Someone  said: Itaposs such a light-hearted thing to do, surprised the joke flew over her head. Plus she wouldnapost have seen themshe hadnapost snooped apostidied.apos Maybe she is having trouble letting go of her son but silly notes arenapost cruel, theyaposre silly notes. While another added: Sheaposs snooping through your home. Iaposd have gone further and left little notes like, aposNobody likes a snoop,apos and aposYou arenapost welcome to go through my things.apos But yours were pretty damn funny.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. news weird-news mysterious-ghost-swing-childrens-play-"Dorset: Ghost swing appears to move on its ownByJohn BettAudience WriterSarah Ping:,  Jan | comments A mysterious apos ghost swingapos that was moving by itself in a childrenaposs play area has left a woman aposcreeped outapos - as sheaposs certain it was a ghoul of some kind. The woman, known only as Charlotte, walked past a public park and noticed that one of the swings was moving on its own, and oddly there was no one around to have pushed it, as Dorset Live reports.She was walking her dog at the time, and at first, she thought there must have been someone in the park that she had missed, but after double-checking, she discovered it was empty. Now Charlotte is convinced that sheaposs seen the ghost of a child, still swinging in their favourite park - and admits sheaposs creeped out. Do you believe in ghosts  Let us know in the comments...Charlotte, from Dorset, said: As I was walking along, I saw this swing just keep swinging. There was no one in the park, no kids either, so it’s not assomeone had just jumped off and let it go. I noticed the swing and watched it for about - seconds. Then I stood there for about  seconds to film it, but even after I left it was still swinging. At first, it was a bit misty, but then I walked across the field and it got really misty to the point I couldnapost see in front of me. So I headed back to my car and headed towards the park when my dog started acting weird. Sometimes they say that animals can pick up these [spiritual] things and my dog was acting really weird. Normally, she runs off and wants to play, but instead she was by my side the whole time.It was like she could feel something. The mysterious incident happened on Tuesday, January , at around pm when it was particularly foggy - which only added to the spooky atmosphere. She continued: It was a bit of a creepy evening as lots of people also posted pictures of how foggy it was. It creeped me out, but not too much - I suppose it was just the little ghost of a child on the swing. I normally walk up there quite a lot but I’ve never noticed this before.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: woman mortified after figuring out
story: Woman mortied after figuring out why she didnt hear back from  jobs she applied forAshleigh Keenan said shed applied for  job openings and was feeling deflated after not hearing anything back - until she realised what shed actually sent employersThe woman was horried when she realised her mistakeImage: Getty Images PhotoAltoByZahna EklundAudience writerLayla Nicholson:,  Jan | commentsAlmost all of us have been turned down for a job at some point in our lives andyouaposve been rejected from multiple at once, youaposll know how frustrating and upsetting it can be. But for one woman, her inability to get called for an interview at around  dferent companies was entirely her own fault - after she made a horrible mistake in her applications. Ashleigh Keenan shared her hilarious blunder on her Twitter account, @AshleighKeenan, where she said that as a teenager she was attempting to attach her CV to ious online applications but later realised she was accidentally uploading data from her period tracker, the Daily Star reports. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. The -year-old accounts manager from Dublin, Ireland, wrote: I will never forget applying for jobs when I was  for months and never hearing anything back, only to realise about  applications later that I was attaching my period tracker and not my CV. Ashleighaposs relatable post has since gone viral and has amassed more than , likes - with hundreds of comments from amused Twitter users. One person wrote: Thanks for that laugh today. It made me laugh out loud. I hope you got great jobs after. You deserve it. While another said: I actually canapost breathe from laughing. Youaposre a legend.  And a third added: Sorry to laugh Ashleigh but that is hilarious. The tweet also caught the attention of job recruiters, who were able to confirm that people send the wrong attachments all the time, as well as other people who had experienced similar blunders. One of the recruiters said: As a recruiter, I cannot stress to the general public enough: please check your attachments. I’ve had everything from nudes, travel documents and even a death certicate. As another relatable commenter posted: I sent my CV under my MSN messenger email and completely forgot that the picture that went with it was me in my boxers standing to attention shall we say. Someone  then added: I applied for work once and was accidentally sending the lyrics to Hurt by Johnny Cash instead of a CV. And there was even a response from work-based social networking site LinkedIn, who tried to see the positives in Ashleighaposs disastrous mistake. They wrote: Period tracker  high levels of organisation, superb planning and general top tier admin skills. Perfect job candidate in my opinion! Have you got a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: woman red faced after taking
story: Woman red-faced after taking picture of clouds that turned out to be snowTwitter user Atousa instantly owned up to her mistake when she realised she hadnt actually photographed clouds, and she was in stitches as she saw the funny sideTwitter user Atousa thought she had taken the perfect picture of the sky Image: sunflower TwitterByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Jan | commentsA woman was left red-faced after taking a picture of what she thought were clouds - but it turned out to be snow on the sunroof above her. Twitter user Atousa was sat in her car and took a selfie, and thought the sky above her looked just right so she captioned her picture aposthe sky!apos But then she noticed something didnapost look quite right, and as she looked closer she saw that the clouds were actually much closer than they first appeared. Then it clicked, she had photographed snow that had settled on the sunroof of her car - and she soon posted a follow-up image to own her hilarious mistake. What do you think of Atousaaposs hilarious picture  Let us know in the comments...The woman initially shared the picture on Snapchat, but later posted the blunder on Twitter and now her post has had over . million likes. Captioning her second picture, she wrote: “I’m so stupid, I thought it was clouds, itaposs f*****g snow on my sunroof! The woman posted the two images on Twitter, captioning the tweet, “On today’s episode of me embarrassing myself.” She was soon inundated with comments as people enjoyed her amusing mistake. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. One said: Ok but I didnapost realize it was snow until I saw the second photo lmao. Then a second added: I thought you are taking selfie inside ISS cupola module. And the background is earth and clouds. Even more embarrassing, And a third wrote: I once called someone talking about thereaposs an orange round thing in the sky. It was the sun setting. I was used to getting home late I forgot how the sun setting looked like.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: full list official covid symptoms
story: Full list of official Covid symptoms from cough and fever to muscle painAcross the coronavirus pandemic the symptoms Brits have suffered from has changed from iant to iant, with others claimed or reported onlineGlobally there are dozens of confirmed symptoms across the Covid iants Image: Getty ImagesByCorrie DavidKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Jan | commentsThroughout the pandemic, the Covid symptoms people have suffered have changed again and again from iant to iant.Whilst a continuous cough was the most known symptom early on, the latest Omicron ant has been more renowned with cold-like symptoms. According to the latest guidance, people who experience symptoms should get a PCR test as soon as they can,WalesOnline reports .But with lesser-known symptoms being reported widely on social media, it’s important to know what the official symptoms are, so people know when to request a PCR test. As stated, dferent iants have manested in dferent symptoms and dferent health bodies have released dfering lists of symptoms. So here’s a number of the dferent symptom lists from key health bodies and studies in one place.  NHS Covid symptomsNHS guidance has remained unchanged since the start of the pandemic, despite new iants leading to dferent symptoms. The three symptoms listed are: A high temperature – this means you feel hot to touch on your chest or backA new, continuous cough – this means coughing a lot for more than an hour or three or more coughing episodes in  hoursA loss or change to your sense of smell or taste – this means youaposve noticed you cannot smell or taste anything or things smell or taste dferent to normal The NHS also lists the same symptoms for children but it notes that cases amongst the young are usually less serious.  WHO Covid symptoms The World Health Organisation has noted that the virus affects people in dferent ways. They have broken down their list into common, less common, and serious symptoms. Most common symptoms are listed as:Fever Cough Tiredness Loss of taste or smell Less common symptoms are listed as:Sore throat Headache Aches and pains Diarrhoea A rash on skin or discolouration of fingers or toes Red or irritated eyes Serious symptoms are listed as:Dficulty breathing or shortness of breath Loss of speech or mobility or confusion Chest painThey recommended that those with serious symptoms should seek immediate medical attention but call aheadvisiting a hospital or doctor.  CDC Covid symptoms The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention acknowledge there are now a aposwide rangeapos of symptoms reported with them appearing anywhere between two and  days after exposure to the virus. Its symptoms covered those reported more commonly with Omicron as well as the original iants. The symptoms listed are:Fever or chills Cough Shortness of breath or dficulty breathing Fatigue Muscle or body aches Headache New loss of taste or smell Sore throat Congestion or runny nose Nausea or vomiting DiarrhoeaThey also advise seeking emergency medical attentiona person develops the following symptoms:  ZOE Covid symptoms The ZOE COVID Study is supported by a grant from the UK Government Department of Health and Social Care and endorsed by NHS Wales and NHS Scotland.It is the largest ongoing study of Covid- with millions reporting their symptoms and conditions in real time. The current most important symptoms to look for:Runny nose Headache Sneezing Sore throat Persistent cough Fever Loss of taste and smell Other symptoms listed by ZOE so far:High temperature Chills or shivers Unusual tirednessSudden confusion, especially in older people Skin rash Changes in the mouth or tongueRed and sore fingers or toes Shortness of breath Chest pain Muscle pain Hoarse voice Diarrhoea Skipping meals Abdominal painsRead MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON CoronavirusOmicron iant" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily coronavirus briefing with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: least 70 people including three
story: At least  people, including three children killed in Yemen airstrikesA further  people are said to have been injured in the hit on a detention centre following an attack on a telecommunications building where three children were killed while playing footballRescuers carry an injured man at the scene where air strikes hit, on a detention centre in Saada Image: REUTERSByAbigail OLearyNews Reporter:,  Jan | commentsAt least  people - including three children - have been killed in airstrikes over Yemen.A further  people are said to have been injured in the hit on a detention centre in Yemen, Doctors Without Borders said.It comes as the Saudi-led coalition continues to ramp up deadly offensive on rebels. Another airstrike on Friday hit a telecommunications building in the port city of Hodeidah, causing a nationwide internet blackout.At least three children were killed as they played football at the time of that attack alone, Save the Children said.The Norwegian Refugee Council said the internet blackout, which was still ongoing as of Friday evening, would affect aid delivery, reports CNN.  The Saudi-led military coalition has been fighting the Iran-aligned Houthi group in Yemen since . The coalition said the report of dozens of deaths on Friday would be investigated using an internationally approved, independent process. Tens of thousands of civilians, including more than , children, have been killed or wounded as a direct result of the fighting. Millions have been displaced and much of the population stands on the brink of famine. The conflict has its roots in the failure of a political process supposed to bring stability to Yemen following an uprising in . Long-time authoritarian president, Ali Abdullah Saleh, eventually handed power to his deputy, Abdrabbuh Mansour Hadi who struggled to deal with growing unrest. The Houthi movement took advantage of the new Presidentaposs weakness. Many ordinary Yemenis - including Sunnis - supported them, and in late  and early  the rebels gradually took over the capital, Sanaa. title: man sacked being fat after
story: Man sacked for being too fat after he moved his family , miles for new roleOnly two hours into their new managers roles at of the Big  Strahan Holiday Retreat in Tasmania, Australia, that Hamish and Hazel Grfin were given the earth-shattering news that they were sackedHamish and Hazel Grfin drove  miles for jobs Image: InstagramByGraeme Murray:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan A man who moved his family , miles away for a new job was sacked for being too fat.The Grfin family left Queensland, Australia, for a new le and and embarked on a long drive to their new home in Tasmania.But the couple were shocked when they met their new employer and were told to pack their bags and leave when they got there It was only two hours into their new manager roles at of the Big  Strahan Holiday Retreat that Hamish and Hazel Grfin were given the earth-shattering news that they were sacked. Mr Grfin reckons the decision by his new employer has violated his human rights.  And he urged others to check on the role and the workplace before agreeing to take up a new post. The dad said he was told his weight would make him unable to carry out his duties which was discovered as he moved a sofa from a shed at the park,I was told I couldnapost do the job because I was too fat. I was told I wouldnapost be able to push a lawn mower or climb a ladder, he told ABC News in Australia. Iaposve been a park manager in north-west Queensland for eight years — Iaposve been doing the job for eight years. Mr Grfin understood such task would be essential every now and then, but his job was not to look after the grounds or do maintenance work. It was a management position, he said.  He was interviewed for the role by video and sent picture to his employers. Theyaposd seen me, they knew what I looked like, he said. Park owners told the ABC News Mr Grfinaposs sacking was because they there were concerned Mr Grfin would get hurt while working in the park. His new employer also insisted Mr Grfin had withheld a health condition. Mr Grfin question why he would tell them and said: Carrying a few extra kilos, in my mind, is not going to inhibit me. The dad posted about his disappointment on social media about the aposheartbreak and embarrassmentapos of his termination just apostwo hoursapos into a new role at the Big holiday park at Strahan, Tasmania  They had only spent one night in their new house before packing the car and leaving the site. Mr Grfin described it as a shock and said his new the boss and his we had visited them and welcomed them with a welcome drink. Now after a taste of paradise and the promise of a new le the family are looking for new jobs and a new place to live. He confessed the most dficult thing was telling his son Freddie and said it he had been absolutely devastated by being told the they were sacked.
